Package fr.ensimag.deca.tree

Class Tree

java.lang.Object
fr.ensimag.deca.tree.Tree
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractDeclClass, AbstractDeclField, AbstractDeclFieldSet, AbstractDeclMethod, AbstractDeclParam, AbstractDeclVar, AbstractInitialization, AbstractInst, AbstractMain, AbstractMethodBody, AbstractProgram, TreeList
public abstract class Tree extends Object
Base class for any node in the Deca abstract syntax tree. Factors all the common elements and utility functions to manipulate trees (location in source-code, pretty-printing, ...).
Version:
$Id: $Id
Author:
gl20

    • printNodeLine

      protected String printNodeLine​(PrintStream s, String prefix, boolean last, boolean inlist)
      wrapper for printNodeLine(PrintStream, String, boolean, boolean, String), calling prettyPrintNode() to display the node element.
      Parameters:
      s - a PrintStream object
      prefix - a String object
      last - a boolean
      inlist - a boolean
      Returns:
      The prefix to use for the next recursive calls to prettyPrint().

    • printNodeLine

      String printNodeLine​(PrintStream s, String prefix, boolean last, boolean inlist, String nodeName)
      Print the line corresponding to the current node. This displays the prefix (to show the tree hierarchy in ASCII-art), and the node name and information.
      Parameters:
      s -
      prefix -
      last -
      inlist -
      nodeName -
      Returns:
      The prefix to use for the next recursive calls to prettyPrint().

    • prettyPrintNode

      String prettyPrintNode()
      Print the node information on a single line. Does not print the children (the recursive call is done by prettyPrint).

    • prettyPrint

      public final void prettyPrint​(PrintStream s)
      Pretty-print tree (see prettyPrint()), sending output to PrintStream s.
      Parameters:
      s - a PrintStream object

    • prettyPrint

      public final String prettyPrint()
      Pretty-print the tree as a String, using ASCII-art to show the tree hierarchy. Useful for debugging.
      Returns:
      a String object

    • prettyPrint

      protected final void prettyPrint​(PrintStream s, String prefix, boolean last)

      prettyPrint.

      Parameters:
      s - a PrintStream object
      prefix - a String object
      last - a boolean

    • prettyPrint

      protected final void prettyPrint​(PrintStream s, String prefix, boolean last, boolean inlist)
      Pretty-print tree (see prettyPrint()). This is an internal function that should usually not be called directly.
      Parameters:
      s - Stream to send the output to
      prefix - Prefix (ASCII-art showing hierarchy) to print for this node.
      last - Whether the node being displayed is the last child of a tree.
      inlist - Whether the node is being displayed as part of a list.

    • prettyPrintChildren

      protected abstract void prettyPrintChildren​(PrintStream s, String prefix)
      Used internally by prettyPrint(java.io.PrintStream). Must call prettyPrint() on each children.
      Parameters:
      s - a PrintStream object
      prefix - a String object

    • iter

      public void iter​(TreeFunction f)
      Call function f on each node of the tree.
      Parameters:
      f - a TreeFunction object

    • iterChildren

      protected abstract void iterChildren​(TreeFunction f)
      Function used internally by iter(TreeFunction). Must call iter() on each child of the tree.
      Parameters:
      f - a TreeFunction object

    • checkDecoration

      protected void checkDecoration()
      Check that the current node has correctly been decorated, and throws an error if not. This is used only for defensive programming, each node type can add checks by overloading this method. Does nothing by default. The method is called automatically by checkAllDecorations().

    • checkAllDecorations

      public boolean checkAllDecorations()
      Check that all nodes of the tree have been correctly decorated. Useful for debugging/defensive programming.
      Returns:
      true. Raises an exception in case of error. The return value is meant to allow assert(tree.checkAllLocations()), to enable the defensive check only if assertions are enabled.

    • checkLocation

      protected void checkLocation()
      Check that the location has been correctly set for this tree. By default, this checks that getLocation() does not return null, but can be overridden for particular classes that do not require location information.

    • checkAllLocations

      public boolean checkAllLocations()
      Check that all nodes of the tree have a location correctly set. Useful for debugging/defensive programming.
      Returns:
      true. Raises an exception in case of error. The return value is meant to allow assert(tree.checkAllLocations()), to enable the defensive check only if assertions are enabled.

    • decompileIfDebug

      protected String decompileIfDebug​(DecacCompiler compiler)
      Call decompile() if the compiler has a debug level greater than 1. Useful for debugging.
      Parameters:
      compiler - a DecacCompiler object
      Returns:
      Decompilation, or the empty string.
